P098979.project_name: Iraq: Household Survey and Policies for Poverty Reduction

keywords.cdata: analytical methods, audits, Bank policies, Beneficiaries, Borrower, Category C, Disbursement, expenditure, female, gender, household income, Household Surveys, living standards, political uncertainty, poverty analysis, poverty assessment, Poverty Assessments, poverty estimates, poverty line, poverty projects, Poverty Reduction, Poverty Reduction PROJECT, Poverty Reduction Strategy, project beneficiaries, Project Management, project objectives, Safeguard Policies, safety, safety nets, Social Impact Assessments, statistical agencies, targeting, Trust Fund, Trust Funds

project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Household Survey and Policies for Poverty Reduction Project is to strengthen the ability of the Government of Iraq (GoI) to make and implement informed policies regarding poverty reduction, job creation and improvement of safety nets in Iraq. This is a level two restructuring to extend the closing date. The extension of the closing dates is necessary to ensure that the project continues to provide logistical support to the continued implementation and completion of the second Iraq Household and Socio-economic Survey (IHSES-2). The extension of the closing date is necessary to ensure that the World Bank has sufficient time to deliver technical assistance (TA) activities and build capacity for relevant policy analysis of data and production of the poverty estimates and their determinants, which will feed into the formulation of the second Poverty Reduction Strategy (PRS) in 2013. The need for extension arises from the delays in forming a government after the 2010 election, which slowed down the functioning of the government, as well as security concerns impacting on the ability to conduct field activities. This will be the fourth and final extension of the closing date.
